data.title: Nick Kyrgios News, Schedule and Ranking - Page 13
data.meta_description: Latest Nick Kyrgios news including schedule, results and ranking on Australian tennis star plus injury updates and more here.
data.text:
Roxy Jacenko proudly takes credit for the tremendous success and wealth of WAG Costeen Hatzi - as boyfriend Nick Kyrgios amasses eye-watering $25million fortune

She's the high-flying social media influencer whose romance with one of the world's biggest tennis stars has made her a household name.

Nick Kyrgios makes surprise offer to Kate Middleton after Wimbledon appearance for Carlos Alcaraz vs Novak Djokovic final

A patron of the world-famous club in South West London, Kate is a huge tennis fan and was warmly received by the Centre Court crowd in just her second public appearance after her shock diagnosis.

Novak Djokovic hails his 'bromance' with Nick Kyrgios as pair share Wimbledon practice game and reveals when the injured Australian could return

Novak Djokovic hailed his 'bromance' with Australian tennis ace Nick Kyrgios as the pair participated in a relaxed practice session together at Wimbledon ahead of Sunday's men's final.

Why Novak Djokovic believes it is 'important' Aussie tennis star Nick Kyrgios plays at the US Open - as their unlikely bromance continues

Nick Kyrgios has told Novak Djokovic he might finally return to competitive action at the US Open - and the Serbian superstar would welcome it, declaring tennis 'really needs him back.'

A grinning Novak Djokovic looks miles away from his feisty court persona as he enjoys time with his children at Wimbledon

The legendary player, 37, grinned as he monkeyed around with his six-year-old daughter - just days after blasting Wimbledon crowds following his straight-sets win over Holger Rune.

Alex de Minaur lets the cat out of the bag as he answers the question every fan wants to know about Nick Kyrgios's return to the court

Kyrgios has not played a match since he pulled out on the eve of last year's Wimbledon as he has been plagued by wrist, knee and foot injuries.

Injury ruined Alex de Minaur's Wimbledon - now it's almost certain to rob him of another sporting dream

The 25-year-old was devastated when an injury he picked up on match point of his win over Arthur Fils forced him to pull out of the tournament - and now another huge disappointment looms.

Nick Kyrgios is accused of 'trolling English weather' after he wears a puffer jacket at Wimbledon

Tennis fans tuning into BBC coverage on Monday night were greeted with the sight of Nick Kyrgios looking like he was ready for the ski slopes in a Stone Island down jacket.

Nick Kyrgios defends Novak Djokovic after Wimbledon outburst while fans slam 'despicable' crowd

The Serb expressed his disappointment at what he felt were boos from pockets of the spectators, although it seemed the crowd were simply cheering 'Ruuuuune' for his opponent.

Nick Kyrgios slams his 'disrespectful' BBC colleague Andrew Castle for his Wimbledon commentary, re-opening their feud after he called him a 'clown'

Nick Kyrgios delights fans with a practice session with former rival Novak Djokovic at Wimbledon

Nick Kyrgios and former rival Novak Djokovic have stepped out for a light-hearted practice session at Wimbledon, with the Aussie targeting a return to action soon.

Nick Kyrgios begs Wimbledon commentator not to bring up one of his legal dramas on TV - and it's NOT his assault conviction

Nick Kyrgios has begged a fellow commentator at Wimbledon not to bring up his previous legal issues, but it was not his common assault charge against a former girlfriend that he was trying to suppress.

Wimbledon star retires on MATCH POINT after injuring himself with a diving volley... as opponent labels decision not to finish 'super weird'

JAMES SHARPE AT WIMBLEDON: The No 7 seed injured himself attempting a diving volley at 7-7 in a fourth-set tie-break but made the shot to bring up set point that would force a decider.

See the bizarre and disturbing reason man held Nick Kyrgios's mum at gunpoint to steal the tennis star's Tesla

The convicted killer who held Nick Kyrgios's mum at gunpoint to steal the tennis ace's Tesla has been sentenced to more than four years in jail over the terrifying incident in May last year.

Aussie basketball star Jack McVeigh skipped his honeymoon to chase his dream of playing at the Olympics - and it looks to have paid off

Nick Kyrgios' most shocking moments from water bottle 'sex act' to match meltdowns and '700 drinks' accusation with Australian tennis star set to join the BBC's commentary team for Wimbledon

Kyrgios's mother, Norlaila, said in a victim impact statement that her encounter with a masked gunman 'shattered my soul, my peace and my perception of the world.'

Nick Kyrgios' influencer girlfriend Costeen Hatzi strips down to a bikini to share her tanning routine

Costeen Hatzi wowed her followers on Wednesday when she stripped down to a black bikini to flaunt her toned figure.

Nick Kyrgios proved he is very much the doting partner to girlfriend Costeen Hatzi on Sunday as he helped cheer her on at the gym.

Kyrgios, 29, has played just one competitive match in nearly two years, with the 2022 Wimbledon finalist struggling with knee and wrist issues that have kept him sidelined.

Jackie 'O' Henderson's 'toy boy tradie' Jack Tyerman signs to major agency after being thrust into spotlight

Jack Tyerman has signed with Roxy Jacenko's digital and creative talent agency The Ministry of Talent.

Nick Kyrgios FINALLY reveals when he'll return to tennis after spending a year out due to horror injury run

Injury-plagued Aussie tennis star Nick Kyrgios has revealed when he will return to the court. The 28-year-old has played just one match in 17 months and admits his career is drawing to a close.

Have there been any vegan Olympic champions?

ANSWERS TO CORRESPONDENTS: As a vegan, Carl Lewis won two golds at the 1992 Barcelona games.

Nick Kyrgios has revealed it was heartbreaking for him to witness Rafael Nadal's withdrawal from the Australian Open.

Tennis legend Pat Cash blasts 'out of control' crowds at the Australian Open as documentary shines a light on the dark side of the Grand Slam
